response:
The clinical presentation of optic neuritis in a young female, combined with signs of spinal cord involvement (dissemination in space), makes Multiple Sclerosis the primary differential. Neuromyelitis Optica (NMOSD) and MOG-antibody disease are key differentials for optic neuritis, especially given the severity of visual loss (6/36). Systemic inflammatory and infectious causes must be excluded.

differential_diagnosis = ["Multiple Sclerosis", "Neuromyelitis Optica Spectrum Disorder (NMOSD)", "MOG Antibody Disease (MOGAD)", "Sarcoidosis", "Systemic Lupus Erythematosus", "Infectious Optic Neuritis (e.g., Syphilis, Lyme disease)", "Compressive Optic Neuropathy"]
